concurrency.WebThreadPoolApplet

Class WebServerControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • concurrency.WebThreadPoolApplet.WebServerControl

  • public class WebServerControl
extends java.lang.Object

    WebServerController controls access to worker threads. Creates a thread pool of four threads that can complete a task for users of the webserver.

    This class is the monitor seen in the associated fsp, it monitors and commands the threads.

    Since:
    2015-03-01
    Author:
    Connor Hallett hallec3@mcmaster.ca

    • Method Detail

      • arrive

        void arrive(WebUser u)
     throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Parameters:
        u - The WebUser that is attempting to arrive at the WebServer.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - users are forced to wait 500ms after their request to insure all users are serviced

      • work

        void work(WebUser u)
   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Delegates a users work to a free thread in the thread pool
        Parameters:
        u - The user that is to have work done
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Throws InterruptedException

      • depart

        void depart()
     throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Increments the monitor when a user is done with a thread
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Makes threads wait while no threads are busy
